com.unimelb.swen30006.mailroom.samples

Class SimpleMailGenerator

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.unimelb.swen30006.mailroom.samples.SimpleMailGenerator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MailSource

    public class SimpleMailGenerator
extends java.lang.Object
implements MailSource
    A class that uses pseudorandomness to generate immutable MailItems at any given time, attempts to simulate random delivery of MailItems to a building

    • Constructor Detail

      • SimpleMailGenerator

        public SimpleMailGenerator(int minFloor,
                           int maxFloor,
                           MailItem.MailPriority[] priorities,
                           MailItem.MailType[] types,
                           int maxNumMail,
                           boolean predictable)
        Create a mail generator with the constraints of the building that is being simulated. Assumes at all times all floors within this range are deliverable.
        Parameters:
        minFloor - the minimum floor (basements are represented by negative floors)
        maxFloor - the maximum floor in the building
        priorities - the priorities that we can select from when generating mail
        types - the types we can select from when generating mail
        maxNumMail - the number of mail items to generate
        predictable - Whether the mail generation should be predictable (i.e. use a fixed seed) or not

        Returns:

        private MailItem generateMail()
        Generates a nem mail item, assigning a random floor, parcel type, priority, size and name based on the building constraints.
